review_pos: hotel building and interior design. great location and hospitality. the swimming pool is the best.
review_neg: I don’t like the idea of using IPad to control lighting and curtains. I don’t like the vanity table lamp that can blinds my eyes. The guest room lighting is too dark.

review_pos: Check in was perfect. The staff was excellent. Splendid customer service, from personal touch to customer service. Need not wait forever on the in-house dining. The room was brilliant. Love all of it.
review_neg: I guess there was a 'hiccup' during parking as the name and plate was provided earlier but upon arrival, no one was able to provide a confirmation and the vehicle cannot enter. However, one of the lady at the reception was so wonderful that she walk all the way to the basement wit me and physically assist with the parking of the vehicle.
review_text: Check in was perfect. The staff was excellent. Splendid customer service, from personal touch to customer service. Need not wait forever on the in-house dining. The room was brilliant. Love all of it. I guess there was a 'hiccup' during parking as the name and plate was provided earlier but upon arrival, no one was able to provide a confirmation and the vehicle cannot enter. review_pos: simply out of this world
review_text: simply out of this world

review_pos: FAntastic room, great restaurants, excellent location, rich history, lovely staff, superb renovations and extensions,
review_neg: The internet service is sub-standard. The upload and download speeds were pedestrian at best. The internet kept dropping out. The default was always Raffles_Meetings, not Raffles. I don’t know who supplies your internet service, but they are ripping you off big time. It’s enough to discourage me from staying with you again. I find the Fullerton to be far superior re internet services.
review_text: FAntastic room, great restaurants, excellent location, rich history, lovely staff, superb renovations and extensions, The internet service is sub-standard. The upload and download speeds were pedestrian at best. The internet kept dropping out. The default was always Raffles_Meetings, not Raffles. I don’t know who supplies your internet service, but they are ripping you off big time. It’s enough to discourage me from staying with you again. I find the Fullerton to be far superior re internet services.

review_pos: The most distinct pleasure of staying at Raffles is the first-class service you receive. Each and every staff member is delightful, very friendly and couldn’t try harder to do anything for you. The attention to detail is remarkable - the staff remember your morning coffee choice, names and things you have told them during your stay, and they deliver a very personalised experience. The food is excellent, and we also ate at Yi restaurant which was delicious. The room by the palm court was lovely and well equipped with everything you could ever need, with everything controlled through one of two iPads in the bedroom and parlour. We couldn’t recommend Raffles enough - we will certainly be returning!
review_neg: Better signage would be useful for certain areas or restaurants as the hotel is a bit of a maze!
review_text: The most distinct pleasure of staying at Raffles is the first-class service you receive. Each and every staff member is delightful, very friendly and couldn’t try harder to do anything for you. The attention to detail is remarkable - the staff remember your morning coffee choice, names and things you have told them during your stay, and they deliver a very personalised experience. The food is excellent, and we also ate at Yi restaurant which was delicious. The room by the palm court was lovely and well equipped with everything you could ever need, with everything controlled through one of two iPads in the bedroom and parlour. We couldn’t recommend Raffles enough - we will certainly be returning! Better signage would be useful for certain areas or restaurants as the hotel is a bit of a maze!

review_pos: The suite is luxurious, the renovation is top quality…. From the marble and wooden floors to all the fittings.
review_neg: I stayed at the courtyard suites. I would have preferred the suite to be slightly larger and brighter (I Hear the Palm court suites are brighter)

review_pos: Hotel and location was excellent. Cleanliness and room service/facilities as well. Front desk, butler and concierge were all very friendly and helpful, waiter at poolside as well.
review_neg: Waiters at breakfast and bar (writers club) seemed to be stressed out and not very friendly.

review_pos: The staff were exceptional.
review_text: The staff were exceptional.

review_pos: Beautiful hotel, room and the grounds. The most beautiful bathroom tiles I have ever seen.Separate lounge and TV area. Paying for prestige.We stayed in John Wayne suite.
review_neg: Breakfast of 2 poached eggs on toast for 2 with carrot juice cost us $150 (AUD) .Later in the week , I ordered more carrot juice and some bananas as needed to take some meds after getting sick and cost us $50.I understand the history and prestige of this hotel but it is way over the top.We ordered a fruit platter in another hotel afterwards and it cost us only $12.Pool area is plain.Not enough sunlight or tropical vibe.The bed was so hard and high (my hubby is 6 foot tall), we chose to sit on the small couch and chairs in the lounge instead.The aircon was difficult to control.
review_text: Beautiful hotel, room and the grounds. The most beautiful bathroom tiles I have ever seen.Separate lounge and TV area. Paying for prestige.We stayed in John Wayne suite. Breakfast of 2 poached eggs on toast for 2 with carrot juice cost us $150 (AUD) .Later in the week , I ordered more carrot juice and some bananas as needed to take some meds after getting sick and cost us $50.I understand the history and prestige of this hotel but it is way over the top.We ordered a fruit platter in another hotel afterwards and it cost us only $12.Pool area is plain.Not enough sunlight or tropical vibe.The bed was so hard and high (my hubby is 6 foot tall), we chose to sit on the small couch and chairs in the lounge instead.The aircon was difficult to control.

review_text: Service was a little slow, waiting up to 40mins for a iron to be delivered.

review_pos: 1. The hotel's service is excellent. All members of staff, from the butlers and cleaning staff, to the reception and waiters, everyone was courteous to a fault. They also knew their job: all my questions and requests were met with willing promptness.2. The restorations have been done with a view to retain as much as possible the original features of the hotel. I am glad that it does not feel like a brand new hotel, nor does it aspire to be one. It retains the quiet, effortless grace of a 134-year-old institution that is secure in its place in the world, with none of the brash and laboured glamour of newer luxury hotel chains.
review_neg: 1. While it isn't big, the property is quite maze-like in its configuration. I got lost a couple of times and had to ask for help from the staff. A proper map (not the escape route on the door) could be provided in each room to help with orientation.2. Some of the decorative items were on the tacky side. The lobby centrepiece on the day of arrival (12 Sep 2021) featured a world globe that on closer look, was actually a 3D jigsaw puzzle, which doesn't belong in a hotel like the Raffles. The bookcase that occupies an entire wall in the Writers Bar would look better with real books instead of an ill-considered menagerie of decorative elephants and other exotic fauna.
review_text: 1. The hotel's service is excellent. All members of staff, from the butlers and cleaning staff, to the reception and waiters, everyone was courteous to a fault. They also knew their job: all my questions and requests were met with willing promptness.2. The restorations have been done with a view to retain as much as possible the original features of the hotel. I am glad that it does not feel like a brand new hotel, nor does it aspire to be one. It retains the quiet, effortless grace of a 134-year-old institution that is secure in its place in the world, with none of the brash and laboured glamour of newer luxury hotel chains. 1. While it isn't big, the property is quite maze-like in its configuration. I got lost a couple of times and had to ask for help from the staff. A proper map (not the escape route on the door) could be provided in each room to help with orientation.2. Some of the decorative items were on the tacky side. The lobby centrepiece on the day of arrival (12 Sep 2021) featured a world globe that on closer look, was actually a 3D jigsaw puzzle, which doesn't belong in a hotel like the Raffles. The bookcase that occupies an entire wall in the Writers Bar would look better with real books instead of an ill-considered menagerie of decorative elephants and other exotic fauna.

review_pos: Loads of added perks available to compensate for closure of restaurants. Complimentary afternoon tea, room upgrade, fruit and sweets on arrival, Singapore Slings, trio in hotel limousine (as we added another night’s stay), family photo.
review_neg: Some work pruning trees during the day which was a bit noisy.

Some work pruning trees during the day which was a bit noisy.

review_pos: The feeling of being “hosted” by people who have know you forever is the special feeling you take with you when  you leave and say see you soon..:-)

review_pos: The property & interior are stunning.Rooms $ other premises are clean .
review_neg: The service was so bad. The hotel is understaffed. One can not reach the chinese restaurant due to lack of direction & also misleading signage.The “butler” could not understand what “Chivas Regal” was ! The room was not cleaned until 12 noon.   The property is too big for Raffles to handle I believe, unless Raffles becomes under the management of a superior hotel chain like four seasons, St Regis or  the Aman, they will be doomed to failure.

review_neg: Quality of service is poor. They forgot to get us a welcome drink, they came to our room for the same reasons multiple times so we were pretty annoyed and wondered if they communicated each other.

They forgot to get us a welcome drink, they came to our room for the same reasons multiple times so we were pretty annoyed and wondered if they communicated each other.

review_pos: Beautiful property and ameneties
review_neg: Services was a bit disappointing got debited twice from my credit card and lots of waiting time for room service
review_text: Beautiful property and ameneties Services was a bit disappointing got debited twice from my credit card and lots of waiting time for room service

review_pos: The recent renovation is superb. The property is in great physical shape.
review_neg: The service & staff just aren't up to standard. Whether it was check in, help with bookings, the butler service or room service, we were left each time wondering where the magic was. Each interaction was a disappointment that we explained away but which collectively added up to a poor experience. Yes, it was bad luck the concierge lost our documents. And the kitchen really was so busy that we understood that an hour and half wait for room service was ok. As for the butler service, I'm sure that our "do not disturb" button was broken and the repeated efforts to clean the room at 8AM on a Saturday morning was just enthusiastic efficiency.
review_text: The recent renovation is superb. The property is in great physical shape. The service & staff just aren't up to standard. Whether it was check in, help with bookings, the butler service or room service, we were left each time wondering where the magic was. Each interaction was a disappointment that we explained away but which collectively added up to a poor experience. Yes, it was bad luck the concierge lost our documents. And the kitchen really was so busy that we understood that an hour and half wait for room service was ok. As for the butler service, I'm sure that our "do not disturb" button was broken and the repeated efforts to clean the room at 8AM on a Saturday morning was just enthusiastic efficiency.

review_pos: Immaculate and beautifully revamped iconic hotel of Singapore.
review_neg: Staff were a big issue. They were constantly slow in providing services. Turn down wasn’t done on two nights of our stay. Pool drinks took over 45 minutes to arrive. General lack of service which is very surprising for a hotel of this Calibre. Hope others get a better service.
review_text: Immaculate and beautifully revamped iconic hotel of Singapore. Staff were a big issue. They were constantly slow in providing services. Turn down wasn’t done on two nights of our stay. Pool drinks took over 45 minutes to arrive. General lack of service which is very surprising for a hotel of this Calibre. Hope others get a better service.
